Package com.rb.nonbiz.collections

Class ClosedUnitFractionHardAndSoftRanges<K>

java.lang.Object
com.rb.nonbiz.collections.ClosedUnitFractionHardAndSoftRanges<K>
public class ClosedUnitFractionHardAndSoftRanges<K>
extends java.lang.Object
A map whose values are ClosedUnitFractionHardAndSoftRange objects.

This is a generalization of the following use case:

Say an asset class is requested to remain between 30% to 40% of total (hard range).

If a portfolio is outside the hard range, we should force it to be a bit inside of the 30%-40% range - i.e. not exactly at the edge (e.g. 30%). For example, we can use the 'soft range' of 31% to 39%, post-trading.

Here's why: If an asset class at 29% was traded to be exactly at 30%, then if it dropped in price more than the other asset classes on the next day and went to 29.99% of the total, the constraint would be violated, and we'd have to trade again.

It's like how a house heating thermostat may turn on the heat when the temperature goes to 68, but only turn it off when it goes to 70. It is to prevent oscillations around a single cutoff point.

These semantics are implemented elsewhere; this class just stores the data.

See Also:
